timeline.bodyText:
String.replaceAll has a performance impact as it is internally compiled like the below
Pattern.compile(regex).matcher(str).replaceAll(repl)
So to get some improvement on performance on this encode method, shall we use the below approach ?
Have the Pattern.compile called once (may be as a class level constant) and then call the match on it within the encode method? That way, it only compiles once
references - https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/lang/String.html#replaceAll-java.lang.String-java.lang.String-
SO - https://stackoverflow.com/questions/1466959/string-replaceall-vs-matcher-replaceall-performance-differences
timeline.author: Kishanthan
